ratings.comment: Very good and caring professor. Available outside of class, utilize office hours. Particpation and lecture quizzes (surveys) each week. Like 4 individual assignments and 3 group projects. Just do your best, ask questions, and do the work. You will learn a lot and do well in the class! Prof Tong is very nice!

Be ready to spend multiple hours (even during thanksgiving break) on long participation and individual assignments that can take up most of you day. Jordan is a very nice guy however and is very open to helping out. He is always very pleasant during lectures.
Learned more in this class than every other college course I have taken combined. Really useful material with real world application.

Quite honestly my very favorite professor at UW. Although this class was a challenge for me as Im not good at analytics, it was extremely beneficial and I feel Ill actually use what I learned in class in my future career. He cares about students and their success and understanding of material. Genuinely a great professor and a great class!

I didn't like Tong much in 300, but he's surprisingly fantastic for Operations Analytics! This class is somewhat frustrating when teammates don't pull their weight in tough group projects, but it's also likely the most useful class you will take at WSoB. Tong cares about your learning, and is really helpful in office hours. This class is inspiring.

Lots of interesting group projects. You will work with everyone else in class on group projects. No exams. Exploring data with different tools and methodologies with group small enough to feel intimate. Loved the class.

Very enjoyable class that teaches you a lot of real world skills in using different software. Tong does a good job of walking through things in class, taking questions, and making sure you understand what you're doing (especially in R). He's not the best at explaining theory but thankfully there's no exams so it's not much to worry about.

This class is not difficult as long as you have some stats and maths background. Lectures are not that bad. I will suggest go to the lecture and really understand the materials. Not much time spent on this course other than lecture and dis section. Don't know why ppl think its hard. Exams are fair, not long, nothing new. Stop complaining.

He tries. He's kind of goofy. I wasn't thrilled with the way he taught, but it's okay. Goes through material way too slowly--can be really dull. Quiz was easy, test was fair. The simulation was fine.  Not as hard as McClurg, but not as good either. Tips: understand the logic behind the math problems, go to discussion, and do all the practice.

Overall nice guy, but terrible professor. Lectures are dry and tests are technical when the technicalities are not needed. Avoid if possible, much better ways to be introduced to operations than this!
Very tough class. Professor Tong is extremely arrogant and not overly helpful. Agree with other posters, avoid. Try and take with Professor McClurg.

Tong has a few interesting lectures, however he does not do a good job explaining concepts.  Although the math required for this course is not complicated he never explains where they come from.  Discussion is much more important for success and lecture is not helpful as it is often confusing. Tests throw difficult random questions from lectures.

OTM is such an easy class it's a joke, especially if you have a stats background. Tong does a pretty good job for the most part and lectures were fine. I thought the Excel assignments were pretty helpful. The readings are pretty much pointless, so don't even bother looking at them other than maybe skimming before the exam.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS! Worst Professor I've ever had. Class is extremely difficult. I'm almost a straight A student and have worked harder this past semester in OTM 300 than I ever have done before. Other reviews must fake or paid for. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

Tong was a great professor. He really cares about what he is teaching and he always asks the class if we need him to change his presentation to better suit us. His lectures aren't the most interesting, but he's a very nice guy and the class is not hard.
Jordan makes this class pretty easy.  He's a really nice guy who cares alot about his subject and is always willing to help if you don't understand something.
Low key this class is worthless. Although Tong is passionate about OTM, the lectures are pointless. Simulations and excel assignments are also pointless. It's not a mystery why nobody majors in OTM.

Professor Tong is one of the best professors I've ever had. He is always willing to help any student. He tries really hard to make the material interesting to students who he knows aren't OTM majors and he does a great job incorporating the material into real life situations. He is in the top 5 best professors I've ever had.

Professor Tong is an amazing professor, especially for being new. If you are a business student there is no way this class should be hard for you. Professor Tong will do anything he can to make the material clear and understandable. By far one of my favorite classes and professors, and it is not my major.

I was a Marketing major before taking this class. I didn't even know what OTM was about, but Jordan grabbed my interest in this field by relating the subject to real-life business examples. The material is very useful, I learned so much from this class and now I am an OTM major just because of this class. My favorite class & professor so far.

This class is the worst class I've taken. The material is completely boring and pointless. Tong is very knowledgeable able the material and is very interested in it. He is not a good teacher though, and lectures are very boring and pointless. The two excel assignments are pretty easy. The group simulations are worthless, but easy. Tests are not bad

Excellent professor who is knowledgeable, articulate, and kind hearted. Stimulates lectures and spreads happiness within classroom. Affordable textbook/workbook. Clear, concise, and precise lectures. Relevant outside topic into discussion. Thoroughly suggest taking the class with Professor Tong. Five stars! !

Jordan knows his stuff, and even if his pace goes fast on some lectures where he has to pack a lot in, he is always available outside of lecture to clarify (which he does aptly and quickly). The group projects and individual assignments made sense (were relevant) and were easy. If you struggle in this class there is a lot of extra credit.
ok

I think this is a great class who likes real world knowledge being applied in class. However, it was a class that was hard to grasp as the content was not very clear and his expectations were high. Not having background in statistics did not help either.
